0.title: India sees 16,135 new COVID-19 cases, 24 deaths; active cases reach 1,13,864
0.article_body: India has reported 16,135 COVID-19 cases, 13,958 recoveries and 24 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,103 cases and 31 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,13,864, while the death toll reached 5,25,223.

1.title: 25 dead, 53 injured in Mumbai last month due to monsoon mishaps: BMC data
1.article_body: Mumbai witnessed 25 deaths and 53 people were injured in more than 600 rain-related incidents in June, according to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data. The highest number of victims (19 deaths) were reported in the Kurla building collapse incident. The civic body has identified 382 dilapidated buildings this monsoon season, of which people still reside in 199 such buildings.

2.title: Why don’t you rename Ahmedabad to Adanibad?: KTR on BJP’s demand to rename Hyd
2.article_body: After BJP leader and ex-Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad’s name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana, TRS leader KT Rama Rao asked, "Why don’t you change Ahmedabad’s name to Adanibad first?" Meanwhile, speaking about BJP’s national executive meet, BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar."

3.title: 4 killed, 7 injured in lightning strikes in UP's Sitapur
3.article_body: Four people were killed and seven others injured after being struck by lightning in separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh’s Sitapur on Sunday. Two of the deceased were working in a field when they were struck by lightning. The SDM said that district administration will provide ₹4 lakh as financial compensation to the deceased’s families. The bodies were sent for post-mortem.

4.title: Iran cuts price of its crude oil in China amid competition with Russia: Report
4.article_body: Iran has discounted its crude oil price in China amid competition with Russia, as per a report. Russian exports to China surged to a record level in May, making it China's biggest supplier of oil and displacing Saudi Arabia from that position. Notably, China's official data only lists three months of imports from Iran since the end of 2020.

5.title: When I got a call for 'Ms Marvel', I had to pinch myself: Farhan
5.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar, who plays the role of Waleed in 'Ms Marvel', has said he's a huge fan of Marvel Cinematic Universe. "So when I got a call from my agent...that 'They're looking for someone out of India and are hoping you'll do this part,' I'd to pinch myself," he added. Farhan appeared in the fourth episode of the show.

6.title: We had to stay patient, wait for England batters to make mistakes: Siraj
6.article_body: After England were bundled out for 284 in their first innings in the ongoing rescheduled Test, India's Mohammed Siraj said they focused on the basics and waited for the England batters to make mistakes. He added that the plan was to hit one area consistently as the ball was "keeping low" on occasions. India ended Day 3 at 125/3.

7.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav falls from stairs at wife's home, fractures shoulder; hospitalised
7.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Lalu Prasad Yadav was admitted to Paras Hospital in Patna. He was hospitalised after he reportedly lost his balance and fell down the stairs at his wife Rabri Devi's residence yesterday. News agency ANI reported that Yadav has suffered a minor fracture in his right shoulder, following which, his health deteriorated.

8.title: Neesham trolls Kohli for sledging Bairstow, says 'Give him a gift basket each morning'
8.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham trolled Virat Kohli for sledging Jonny Bairstow on Day 3 of the rescheduled fifth Test. "Why do opposing teams keep making...Bairstow angry lol, he gets 10x better," Neesham wrote. He added, "Give him a gift basket each morning, let him know you're having his car valeted while he's batting. Anything to keep him happy."

9.title: Team India opener smashes fifty in a Test at Edgbaston for the first time after 36 years
9.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Sunday became the first India opener to smash a fifty in a Test at Edgbaston in 36 years. Prior to Pujara, Sunil Gavaskar was the last India opener to smash a Test fifty at Edgbaston in 1986. Between Gavaskar and Pujara's fifties, Gautam Gambhir's 38(64) in 2011 was the highest score by an India opener at Edgbaston.

10.title: Broke leg, hand gestures became famous as Bobby Deol style: Bobby on 'Gupt...'
10.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol said that he had broken his leg while shooting for the movie 'Barsaat'. "And 'Gupt: The Hidden Truth' was immediately after that. I had an accident on the former's last day, so Chinni and Rekha Prakash ji made those hand movements of mine, which became popular as 'Bobby Deol's style'," he added.

11.title: Sri Lanka extends school closures amid unprecedented fuel crisis
11.article_body: Sri Lanka extended school closures for one more week starting July 4 amid unprecedented fuel crisis. The government and state-approved private schools will remain closed as there's not enough fuel for teachers and parents to get children to classrooms. Last month, the schools were shut nationwide for a day and remained closed in urban areas for the last two weeks.

12.title: Policeman shot at by terrorists in his home in J&K's Anantnag
12.article_body: A policeman was injured after he was shot at by terrorists in his home in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Sunday, police officials said. A police spokesperson said that the policeman had been taken to a hospital. "Investigation is in progress and officers continue to work to establish the full circumstances of this terror crime," an officer said.

13.title: Over 1 million people got jobs in past 2 yrs on Rozgar Bazaar: Delhi govt
13.article_body: The Delhi government has claimed that over one million people got jobs through its digital job matching portal, Rozgar Bazaar since its launch on July 27, 2020. Jobs across 32 job categories have been generated till June 2022, the government said. Notably, the platform was launched to help entry-level and blue-collar job seekers connect with employers during COVID-19-induced lockdown.

14.title: Harshal smashes 54(36) as India win 2nd T20 warm-up match by 10 runs
14.article_body: Team India defeated Northamptonshire by 10 runs to win the second and final T20 warm-up game on Sunday. India were 8/3 at one point in the game but Harshal Patel smashed 54 off 36 to help his side reach 149/8. The 31-year-old then picked two wickets, conceding 23 runs as Northamptonshire were bundled out for 139 in 19.3 overs.

15.title: Organs of brain dead auto-rickshaw driver save 4 lives in Delhi
15.article_body: A 45-year-old auto-rickshaw driver from Bihar, Karu Singh, was declared brain dead at Delhi's AIIMS. His family decided to donate his organs, which helped save four patients' lives. Singh's heart was transplanted to a 40-year-old woman, his liver to a 62-year-old man, one of his kidneys to a 56-year-old woman and the other to a 37-year-old woman.

16.title: Half genuine, half sponsored: Fadnavis on protests against Aarey car shed
16.article_body: The newly elected Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the issue created around shifting Metro-3 car shed project back to Aarey is "half genuine and half sponsored" and added that it was "only solution to Mumbai's congestion". "Work was paused after 25% of it had been completed. The cost has already been escalated by ₹10,000 crore," Fadnavis further said.

17.title: Firm loses ₹15 lakh from account in suspected cyber attack in Pune
17.article_body: An engineering firm lost ₹15 lakh from its bank account within hours in an alleged cyber attack in Pune. According to the FIR, the money was siphoned off after a beneficiary was fraudulently added in the firm's bank account and the transaction limit was raised from ₹2 lakh. The money was siphoned in six transfers, added the FIR.

18.title: We rob bank, you rob whole nation; Bye Bye Modi: Money Heist posters in Hyd
18.article_body: 'Money Heist' themed poster was seen in Hyderabad amid the BJP national executive meeting. "We only rob bank, you rob the whole nation," the poster said, adding, "Bye Bye Modi." The poster also mentioned names of states including Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Karnataka, Maharashtra and Bihar. Reports said photos and videos of 'Money Heist' mascots on Hyderabad streets were also shared.

19.title: Truck hits 4 vehicles after brakes fail in Pune; 3 killed, 2 hurt
19.article_body: Three people, including an infant, were killed and two others injured after a truck hit two cars and two bikes near Lavale Phata in Pune on Sunday. The truck, which was carrying tiles, was on a steep slope when the driver lost control as the vehicle's brakes apparently failed, according to officials. The truck driver was arrested in the matter.

20.title: Rohit Sharma tests negative for COVID-19, begins net practice
20.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma is out of isolation and was seen at the nets after having tested negative for COVID-19. Rohit missed the ongoing rescheduled Test against England after he tested positive during the four-day warm-up game against Leicestershire. He's expected to be available for the white-ball series against England that begins with the first T20I on July 7.

21.title: Lost states because of BJP's superior money power: Cong's Abhishek Singhvi
21.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said the party lost some states because of the "climate of fear", successfully created by the PM Narendra Modi-led government by misusing central agencies. On being asked, from Karnataka to Maharashtra, non-BJP parties have not been able to retain power in many states, Singhvi said, "Yes, we've lost these states because of BJP's superior money power."

22.title: British Army's Twitter & YouTube briefly hacked, posts made on NFTs & Musk
22.article_body: The British Army regained control of its Twitter and YouTube accounts on Sunday after they were briefly hacked. While the YouTube channel was renamed 'Ark Invest' and videos on cryptocurrency with images of the world's richest man Elon Musk appeared there, the Twitter account retweeted several posts related to NFTs. The Army later said it will investigate the incident.

23.title: 22-year-old gunman opens fire at Denmark mall; 3 killed, several wounded
23.article_body: A gunman opened fire inside a busy shopping mall in Copenhagen on Sunday, killing three people and critically wounding three others, police said. A 22-year-old Danish man was arrested after the shooting, police added. According to police, the victims included a man in his 40s and two young people while several others were injured, three of them critically.

24.title: Who is 21-year-old Sini Shetty, winner of Miss India 2022?
24.article_body: Sini Shetty, who has been crowned Miss India 2022, was born in Maharashtra's Mumbai and is 21 years old. She hails from Karnataka. She did her schooling from St Dominic Savio Vidyalaya in Mumbai. She holds a bachelor's degree in accounting and finance and is currently pursuing a course in Chartered Finance Analyst (CFA). She is also a Bharatanatyam dancer.

25.title: History-sheeter arrested for stealing gold, silver from Pune flat
25.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested for breaking into a Pune flat and stealing about a kilogram of gold and three kilograms of silver ornaments. The incident occurred on June 20, when the target family had gone out to buy a puppy. According to the police, the accused is a history-sheeter with 18 cases of burglary against him.

26.title: 17-yr-old boy fined ₹17,500 for posting bike stunt videos in B'luru
26.article_body: A 17-year-old boy who performed bike stunts and posted them on social media was fined ₹17,500 in Bengaluru, police said on Sunday. Cases were filed based on the videos, which showed the stunts could be "dangerous" for others, Joint Police Commissioner (Traffic) BR Ravikanthe Gowda said. As the boy is a minor, cases were filed against his parents, he added.

27.title: Hyd man killed, body set ablaze by wife's family for marrying against choice
27.article_body: A 25-year-old man, a resident of Hyderabad, was killed and his body was set on fire by his wife's family as they objected to couple's marriage. Police said the two got married last year but wife's family did not approve of their marriage and forcibly took her away. Her family called victim on pretext of resolving differences and killed him.

28.title: Shinde govt may fall in next 6 months, be prepared for mid-term polls: Pawar
28.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led government in Maharashtra is likely to fall in the next six months and everyone should be prepared for mid-term elections in the state. He further added that many rebel MLAs are not happy with the current arrangement and once the ministerial portfolios are distributed, their unrest will come out.

29.title: MCD doubles fines for mosquito breeding at houses, construction sites
29.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has doubled the fine for mosquito breeding in households, offices and construction sites as well as in containers in home and office spaces. As per the new slab, for residential areas, the fines have been increased to ₹100 per container from ₹50 and for commercial office and educational premises, it has become ₹200 from ₹100.

30.title: Karnataka's 21-year-old Sini Shetty crowned Miss India 2022
30.article_body: Mumbai-born 21-year-old Sini Shetty, who hails from Karnataka, was named Miss India 2022 at the 58th Femina Miss India beauty pageant. Miss India 2020 Manasa Varanasi crowned Sini, who will go on to represent India at the next edition of the Miss World pageant. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Shinata Chauhan was declared the second runner-up and Rubal Shekhawat was named first runner-up.

31.title: Cheteshwar Pujara slams fifty as India lead England by 257 runs after Day 3
31.article_body: India ended the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at 125/3 in the second innings, leading England by 257 runs. Cheteshwar Pujara is unbeaten on 50*(139), while Rishabh Pant is unbeaten on 30*(46). Earlier in the day, England were dismissed for 284 runs in their first innings, with Mohammed Siraj picking four wickets.

32.title: North Korea criticises US, South Korea, Japan tripartite agreement
32.article_body: Pyongyang has criticised the recent agreement between the US, South Korea and Japan to explore further means of reinforcing "extended deterrence" against North Korea. It said the agreement materialises an alliance like NATO. Pyongyang also said the US is "spreading rumour" about a "threat from North Korea" to gain military supremacy over the Asia-Pacific, North Korean state media reported Sunday.

33.title: Russian ship with stolen Ukrainian wheat held in Turkey: Ukraine
33.article_body: Turkish customs authorities have detained a Russian cargo ship carrying wheat stolen from Ukrainian territory, Ukraine's ambassador to Turkey said on Sunday. He said a future course of action regarding the ship will be reached after a meeting of investigators on Monday. Ukraine had previously asked Turkey to detain the ship, as per documents and an official cited by Reuters.

34.title: Working to fully safeguard US users' data: TikTok to US lawmakers
34.article_body: ByteDance owned TikTok has told US senators that it was working on an agreement to "fully safeguard user data and US national security interests," as per a letter. This comes amid claims that the social media app has leaked US user data to China. TikTok acknowledged that in the past Chinese employees had data access to US user data.

35.title: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts in India in May
35.article_body: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts of Indian users in May over violation of its guidelines, it said in its monthly compliance report on Sunday. While 43,656 accounts were removed over child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity, and similar content, some 2,870 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Between April 26 and May 25, Twitter received 1,698 complaints in India.

36.title: 102 people killed in Bangladesh floods so far
36.article_body: The death toll due to the floods in Bangladesh has reached 102, the country's Directorate General of Health Services said. The government agency said that among the deceased, 75 died by drowning, 15 from lightning strikes, two from snake bites, and the rest due to other reasons. The agency said the deaths occurred between May 17 and July 3.

37.title: Pavithra Lokesh claims media representatives stalking her, files complaint
37.article_body: Telugu and Kannada actress Pavithra Lokesh has filed a complaint in Mysuru's VV Puram Police Station claiming that some representatives of the media are stalking her. The actress has stated that they are destroying her peace of mind. She had earlier alleged that fake accounts with her name were made on social media that are making defamatory posts.

38.title: Sainz claims first F1 win at British GP after crash delays the race
38.article_body: Carlos Sainz won first career Formula One race on his 150th start at the British Grand Prix on Sunday. The Ferrari driver beat Red Bull's Sergio Perez and Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton. Part one of the race was red-flagged as Alfa Romeo driver Zhou Guanyu was stretchered off after a major crash on turn one. Championship leader Max Verstappen finished seventh.

39.title: WhatsApp may increase time limit of 'delete for everyone' feature: Report
39.article_body: Meta-owned messaging platform WhatsApp is beta testing the option to increase the time limit for its 'delete for everyone' feature, as per reports. According to WABetaInfo, which offers real-time updates about WhatsApp, the feature has been rolled out for beta testing to a limited number of users. The new limit for the update may be two days and 12 hours.

40.title: Amazon lets Prime users unsubscribe in 2 clicks after EU complaints
40.article_body: The European Commission has said that after complaints from consumer groups, Amazon has made it easier for users to cancel their Prime subscriptions in the region. Users can now unsubscribe with two clicks via a prominent and clear 'cancel button', the Commission said. As per the complaints, users had to earlier go through complicated menus, skewed wording and confusing choices.

41.title: Why is Australia killing millions of honeybees?
41.article_body: Australian authorities have killed over six million honeybees after an outbreak of the deadly varroa mite that was first reported in Sydney last week. The parasitic insect, known to be the biggest threat to bees worldwide, attacks and feeds on honeybees, crippling them and impairing their flight performance. The extermination is being done to save Australia's multimillion-dollar honey industry.

42.title: Don’t blame me: Rohit Shetty on high budget of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
42.article_body: When asked if he's the reason why the budget of 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' has increased, filmmaker Rohit Shetty replied, "Don’t blame me. 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is an expensive show, I think by far one of the most expensive ones." "The scale and quality of the show require that kind of...budget. It has nothing to do with me," he added.

43.title: Sri Lanka struggling to raise $587mn to pay for fuel shipments: Lankan Minister
43.article_body: Sri Lanka needs to pay $587 million for several fuel shipments, said a top minister amid its worst financial crisis and crippling fuel shortage. The country is struggling to raise enough funds to pay for essential imports of items like fuel, food and medicines. Its central bank can supply only about $125 million, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.

44.title: Madhubala's biopic will not include Kishore Kumar & Dilip Kumar: Madhur
44.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said the family wants to celebrate the actor through the biopic. "We are sure that we don’t want to hurt anybody while telling this tale. We don’t want to get into what happened with Dilip Kumar and Kishore Kumar," she added. "They've families, wives and children, too. Every relationship has its ups and downs," she said.

45.title: Two dead as boulder crushes car in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district
45.article_body: A couple was killed on Sunday in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district when a boulder rolled down a hill and crushed the car they were travelling in, police said. The accident took place on the Karnaprayag-Gwaldam national highway, police added. The deceased have been identified as 42-year-old Balbir Singh and his 40-year-old wife Savitri Devi.

46.title: Delhi govt adds Jagannath Puri Yatra under its free pilgrimage scheme
46.article_body: Delhi government will be sending pilgrims for Jagannath Puri Yatra in Odisha under its free pilgrimage scheme, officials said on Sunday. Two trains under the 'Mukhyamantri Tirth Yatra Yojana' will depart for Puri with the pilgrims on July 11 and July 28. The scheme, which was introduced in 2019, was suspended due to the pandemic and resumed in December 2021.

47.title: FPIs withdraw ₹50,203 crore in June, highest net outflow in 2 years
47.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net sum of ₹50,203 crore from equities in June, data showed. This is the highest net outflow since March 2020, when they pulled out ₹61,973 crore. Overall, in the first six months of 2022, FPIs pulled out around ₹2.2 lakh crore from domestic equities, which is the highest-ever net withdrawal by them.

48.title: NDMC plans to launch mobile education vans for labourers' children
48.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) plans to launch mobile school vans to educate labourers' kids and homeless kids. NDMC Vice Chairperson Satish Upadhyay said that before implementation, a feasibility survey will be conducted to identify the number of such students. Lauding Gujarat's 'school on wheels' initiative, he said that they will contact Gujarat education department for ideas.

49.title: HC to hear plea alleging Ram Rahim has been replaced with impostor
49.article_body: The Punjab & Haryana HC will hear a plea on Monday that seeks to "verify the authenticity" of Gurmeet Ram Rahim and ascertain if he has been replaced with an impostor. The petitioners, who have claimed to be followers of Dera Sacha Sauda, have listed multiple changes they claim they have noticed in Ram Rahim's figure and personality.

50.title: JSW Steel to invest ₹10,000cr to reduce carbon footprint: Chairman
50.article_body: JSW Steel has earmarked ₹10,000 crore for investments to reduce its carbon footprint, JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said. He added that this will be done by increasing the use of renewable energy to replace thermal power and reduce the firm's fuel rate, among others. "We have committed to reducing our CO2 emissions intensity...by 42% by 2030," Jindal said.

51.title: Chip business turnover expected to be around $3.5bn: Vedanta Group
51.article_body: Vedanta Group's global MD of display and semiconductor business Akarsh Hebbar said the firm expects its semiconductor business turnover to be in the range of $3 to $3.5 billion. "This will be from both display and semiconductor combined...We expect $1 billion to come from exports," he added. The firm has earmarked investments of up to $20 billion for the business.

52.title: Four of a family killed in Lakhimpur Kheri as bus hits motorcycle
52.article_body: Four members of a family, including three females, were killed in a road accident in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri on Sunday when a speeding bus hit their motorcycle, police said. The deceased, including a 7-year-old girl, were identified as residents of Dhaurahra village. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem and the driver of the bus has been arrested, police added.

53.title: Health emergency declared in Puducherry district over diarrhoea outbreak
53.article_body: Puducherry's Directorate of Health and Family Welfare Services has declared a public health emergency in Karaikal district, following an outbreak of acute diarrhoea over the last few days. Examination of drinking water samples in the region was found to be not safe for consumption, the  Health Director said. Citizens have been asked to drink boiled water and ensure personal hygiene.

54.title: PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar: Ravi Shankar Prasad
54.article_body: Speaking about BJP's national executive meet in Hyderabad, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar which is significant for all of us." "Sardar Patel kept the foundation of a unified India and now it's BJP's responsibility to carry it further," he added. PM Modi addressed the meet on Sunday.

55.title: I have a dream that once I will do a negative role: Ranbir
55.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he once wants to play a negative role. "I've a dream that once I'll do a negative role and people will tell their kids ‘so jaa, so jaa nahi toh Ranbir aa jayega!'" "As our cinema evolves, the villain's character...is becoming complex and interesting. I’m looking forward to the bad guys we're yet to watch," he added.

56.title: Sorry had to kick out British player Watson: Jule on Wimbledon 4th round win
56.article_body: Germany's Jule Niemeier has entered maiden Grand Slam quarter-final on her Wimbledon debut, defeating Great Britain's Heather Watson 6-2, 6-4 in the fourth round on Sunday. "I can't believe it. I want to say sorry I had to kick out a British player today. The atmosphere was incredible," said Niemeier. The 22-year-old will now face compatriot Tatjana Maria.

57.title: Will restrain Centre from destabilising Oppn state govts: Sinha
57.article_body: The Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has said that he won't hesitate to restrain Centre if it "aids and abets" the destabilisation of state governments run by Opposition parties. "I have declared that I shall speak out against any attempts aimed at communal polarisation...I have also announced that I shall work for the repeal of the sedition law," Sinha added.

58.title: Films don't fail, budgets do; producer shouldn't lose money: Taapsee
58.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu stated that films don't fail but budgets do, adding that it's a universal fact irrespective of whether it's Bollywood or Hollywood. "The most important fact should be that your producers shouldn't be losing money, this is true for an actor and actress," she added. Taapsee further said it is an actor's duty to keep that in mind.

59.title: 34-yr-old mother-of-two Maria enters 1st Slam singles quarters at Wimbledon
59.article_body: Unseeded German Tatjana Maria saved two match points to beat 12th seeded Jelena Ostapenko 5-7, 7-5, 7-5 in the fourth round at Wimbledon and reached her first Grand Slam singles quarter-final on Sunday. Notably, the 34-year-old mother of two, who returned from maternity leave less than a year ago, is the oldest player left in the women's draw.

60.title: Russian scientist dies days after arrest for state treason
60.article_body: A scientist who was arrested from Siberia earlier this week by Russian authorities on charges of state treason has died, his lawyer told Reuters on Sunday. Dmitry Kolker's lawyer said, "He died yesterday. Tomorrow we will lodge a complaint over his detention." Kolker was reportedly suffering from advanced pancreatic cancer. According to Kolker's family, he was detained from a hospital.

61.title: Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave Manchester United: Reports
61.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has told the Premier League club that he wants to leave the club because of his desire to play in the Champions League, UK's The Times newspaper reported on Saturday. The report added that the 37-year-old Portuguese footballer believes that he can play at the elite level for another "three of four years".

62.title: Pic of Tom Cruise's stunt from new 'Mission Impossible' surfaces
62.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing actor Tom Cruise dangling from the wing of a plane as it does a nosedive and then performs a barrel roll. The stunt is from his upcoming film 'Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One'. Tom reportedly also rides a motorcycle off the edge of a cliff and parachutes off in the film.

63.title: Katariya scores as India hold England to 1-1 draw in their women's hockey WC 2022 opener
63.article_body: Vandana Katariya scored in the 28th minute as India held England to a 1-1 draw in their women's hockey World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday. Katariya's equaliser came 19 minutes after England's Isabelle Petter opened the scoring. India will next face China in their Pool B clash on Tuesday. The World Cup is being held in Spain and Netherlands.

64.title: Hope to play Wimbledon one more time: 8-time champion Federer
64.article_body: Eight-time champion Roger Federer said he hopes to play Wimbledon "one more time". Attending a special ceremony to mark the 100th anniversary of Centre Court on Sunday, Federer stated, "This court has given me my biggest wins and my biggest losses." The Swiss hasn't played a competitive match since losing in quarter-final of last year's Championships to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz.

65.title: Pics show the moment a woman was eaten by shark in Egypt
65.article_body: A footage of a 68-year-old tourist from Austria being attacked by a shark in Egypt has surfaced online, following which the country's Red Sea Governorate ordered closure of several Red Sea beaches. The woman died in an ambulance after losing an arm and a leg in the attack. The footage showed the woman trying to swim back to shore.

66.title: I should have been a mom at 19, I was ready but it got delayed: Sushmita
66.article_body: Speaking about becoming a mother, actress Sushmita Sen said she wanted to adopt much earlier. "I was delayed as far as I was concerned, I should've been a mom at 19, I was ready," she said. "I...knew it was time and during Miss Universe is the first time I entered an adoption centre...Something inside [me] was not okay," she added.

67.title: 'Friends' creator gives $4mn to University due to guilt over show's lack of diversity
67.article_body: 'Friends' co-creator Marta Kauffman has said she's donating $4 million to Brandeis University after feeling "embarrassed" by and "guilty" over the sitcom's lack of diversity. Kauffman is donating the sum for an endowed professorship in the African and African American Studies Department. "It took me a long time to begin to understand how I internalised systemic racism," she said.

68.title: Ukrainian forces hit Russian military logistics base in Melitopol
68.article_body: Ukrainian forces struck a Russian military logistics base in Russia-occupied Melitopol on Sunday, the city's exiled mayor Ivan Fedorov said. "At 3 o'clock (0000 GMT) and 5 o'clock (0200 GMT), there were over 30 strikes on a single military base," Fedorov stated. A Russia-installed official confirmed the Ukrainian strikes but no information was provided regarding the target of the strikes.

69.title: KCR has no care for unemployment, only wants his son to be CM: Shah
69.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has no concern for the unemployed youth and only wants his son to be the CM of the state. Shah added he doesn't care about the people's source of livelihood, adding that the next term is reserved neither for his son nor him, but for BJP.

70.title: Telangana govt has become a symbol of corruption: Piyush Goyal
70.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that the Telangana government has become a symbol of corruption, adding that the state's residents want a change. Goyal further stated that members from the same family hold key positions in the state government. His remarks came on the second day of the BJP's national executive meet, which was held in Secunderabad.

71.title: Will prove majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's floor test: Maha Deputy CM
71.article_body: Ahead of the newly-formed Maharashtra government's floor test in the Assembly on Monday, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said, "We will prove our majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's vote of confidence." "The youngest Speaker candidate won the Speaker election with 164 votes today as 2 MLAs couldn't come due to health issues," Fadnavis added.

72.title: Kanye West sued for copyright infringement over sample on 'Flowers'
72.article_body: A copyright infringement lawsuit has been filed against rapper Kanye West for allegedly using a sample on his song 'Flowers' from his new album 'Donda 2'. Musician Marshall Jefferson has alleged that a sample from his 1986 song 'Move Your Body (House Music Anthem)' is "repeated at least 22 times throughout" 'Flowers' without gaining permission or providing compensation.

73.title: Death toll from landslide in Manipur's Noney reaches 42; 20 still missing
73.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney increased to 42, after eight more bodies were recovered from under the debris during a search operation on Sunday. As per reports, the search operation may take a few more days. Around 20 persons are reportedly still missing.

74.title: Our fighter jets to guard Slovakia's airspace from Sept: Czech PM
74.article_body: Czech Republic's PM Petr Fiala said on Sunday that the country's fighter jets will begin guarding neighbouring Slovakia's airspace from September. The move comes after Slovakia requested its NATO allies to patrol its airspace as it decided to ground its Russian-made MiG-29 fighter jets. The MiG-29 fighter jets are likely to be sent to Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion.

75.title: Centre to declare startup rankings of states on July 4
75.article_body: The results of the 3rd Ranking of States' on Support to Start-up Ecosystems will be released by Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday. Conducted by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), 24 states and 7 Union Territories participated in the exercise. The rankings encourage states, UTs to strengthen support to the startup ecosystem, the government stated.

76.title: World no. 66 Bouzkova reaches 1st Grand Slam quarters at Wimbledon
76.article_body: World number 66 Marie Bouzkova has reached her first Grand Slam quarter-final after beating France's Caroline Garcia 7-5, 6-2 in fourth round at Wimbledon on Sunday. "If you would tell me before the tournament started I'd be in the quarters, I probably wouldn't believe you," said Bouzkova. The 23-year-old Czech will next face either third-seeded Ons Jabeur or Elise Mertens.

77.title: Virat Kohli blows a kiss after taking catch to dismiss Bairstow, video goes viral
77.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli blew a kiss after taking a catch to dismiss Jonny Bairstow in England's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test. Bairstow was dismissed on the bowling of Mohammad Shami. Bairstow scored 106 runs off 140 deliveries. Earlier in the innings, the duo were seen sledging each other.

78.title: Video shows truck powered by jet engines exploding while racing planes in US, 1 killed
78.article_body: The 40-year-old driver of a truck that was powered by jet engines was killed during a US airshow after the vehicle exploded. The accident was caught on video and it showed the vehicle catching on fire while racing two planes that were flying above it. Chris Darnell was killed while driving the truck at 300 miles (483 km) per hour.

79.title: Fan walked up my building's stairs to meet me, it was scary: Kiara
79.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani revealed that a fan once walked up all the stairs of her building to meet her, adding she lives on a very high floor. She said he wanted to tell her how much she means to him. "I was like...'Why? You could've just taken the lift...But don't come to my house next time, it's...scary also'," Kiara said.

80.title: Our approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in 2nd ODI: Vastrakar
80.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar said her side's approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in the second ODI in Pallekele. "We'll have our first game approach in the second match. And we would like to win the series 3-0," she added. The match will be played on Monday. India are leading the three-match series 1-0.

81.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger receives go-ahead from NSE and BSE
81.article_body: HDFC Bank and parent HDFC on Sunday said that they have received "no adverse observations" from BSE and "no objection" from the National Stock Exchange (NSE) for their merger. However, in separate regulatory filings, they noted that the proposed HDFC-HDFC Bank merger still requires approvals from the RBI, CCI and NCLT. The merger was announced in April this year.

82.title: Drake makes surprise appearance at Backstreet Boys' Toronto concert
82.article_body: Rapper Drake made a surprise appearance onstage during band Backstreet Boys' concert at the Budweiser stage in Canada's Toronto. A video which is going viral shows the band performing their 1999 song 'I Want It That Way' while Drake sings his 2013 song 'Hold On, We're Going Home' merged with it. Backstreet Boys is currently on their DNA World Tour.

83.title: I just hope the delivery is normal: Harsh Varrdhan on sister Sonam's pregnancy
83.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor's brother, actor Harsh Varrdhan, while talking to a news portal, revealed that he is excited about Sonam's pregnancy. "I am excited. Let’s just hope that the delivery is normal and Sonam is okay. Honestly speaking, I am not good with kids," he added. "It is a new experience for all of us," Harsh Varrdhan said.

84.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann likely to expand Cabinet on July 4
84.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann likely to induct five new ministers and expand the Cabinet on Monday, according to reports. The oath taking ceremony will take place in Raj Bhawan at 5 pm, reports quoted an official as saying. With this, the Punjab Cabinet will have 15 ministers, including the Chief Minister. This will be CM Mann's first Cabinet expansion.

85.title: WhatsApp working on feature to let users hide 'Online' status: Report
85.article_body: WhatsApp is reportedly working on a new feature that will allow users to hide their 'Online' status from specific contacts. Users will reportedly get to choose who can see when they are online by either selecting 'Everyone' or 'Same as Last Seen'. Notably, for 'Last Seen' status setting, users get four options: Everybody, My Contacts, My Contacts Except, and Nobody.

86.title: BJP will resolve all problems of Northeast by 2024: Amit Shah
86.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that BJP has found a permanent address to the issues in the Northeastern states. Speaking at the BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, Shah said that all problems of the Northeast will be resolved by 2024 and the region will face no issues in the coming times.

87.title: Himachal Police holds constable exam for second time after paper leak
87.article_body: The constable recruitment exam for Himachal Police was held on Sunday, amid tight security, for the second time after a question paper leak led to the exam's cancellation in March. More than 75,000 candidates appeared for the examination this time. "There are flying squads, there are checking teams. We have frisking staff at every examination centre," said DIG Sumedha Dwivedi.

88.title: India gifts 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to Nepal
88.article_body: India on Sunday gifted 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to Nepal as part of its ongoing efforts to build on a "robust and longstanding" partnership between the two countries. The vehicles will be handed over to various governmental departments and NGOs working in healthcare and education sectors in various districts of Nepal, the Indian mission said.

89.title: NDRF deploys six teams in flood-prone districts of Gujarat
89.article_body: The NDRF on Sunday deployed six teams in various districts of Gujarat and placed them on standby to deal with possible floods caused by incessant rainfall in the state. Four teams have been sent to the Rajkot district and one each to the Surat and Banaskantha districts. In the Anand district, two people died after drowning in rainwater this week.

90.title: Only the best proposal from start-ups can attract funds: Mariwala
90.article_body: Marico Chairman Harsh Mariwala believes that corrections are happening in the start-up funding ecosystem. "With the funding environment tightened, now only the best proposal from start-ups can attract funds," he said. Mariwala further stated that funders are increasing time frames, but that it was justified because scaling of businesses and growth rate was also higher.

91.title: Taught me tremendous grace: Sushmita on winning Miss India & Miss Universe titles
91.article_body: Speaking about winning Miss India and Miss Universe titles, Sushmita Sen said, "Winning Miss Universe [was] making history for my country. One of the things that was ingrained while I left from here was, don't expect much, so that victory was a different victory altogether." "[It] taught me tremendous grace. It showed me generosity of spirit," she added.

92.title: IFS officer's video of cheetah climbing & sitting on tourist vehicle goes viral
92.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Surender Mehra shared a video of a cheetah climbing a tourist vehicle during a safari, which has gone viral on Twitter. The clip shows the animal climbing up onto the vehicle's spare wheel before reaching its roof and sitting down. "Man in wild," said Mehra while sharing the video.

93.title: Delhi L-G inspects drainage at waterlogged sites amid monsoons
93.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena inspected waterlogged sites such as Indraprastha-WHO stretch, Railway underpass at Pul Prahladpur and Minto Bridge. Officials were instructed to make drainage in these areas fool-proof. "The L-G instructed the officials to put in place a comprehensive plan consisting of long-term measures to deal with the problem of waterlogging," the L-G's office said.

94.title: Bairstow was playing like Pujara, Kohli unnecessarily made him Pant by sledging: Sehwag
94.article_body: Reacting to England's Jonny Bairstow's 106(140) against India in the rescheduled fifth Test, Virender Sehwag stated that Bairstow was playing like Cheteshwar Pujara, but Virat Kohli unnecessarily made him Rishabh Pant by sledging. Notably, Bairstow was batting on 13 runs from 61 deliveries before being sledged by Kohli. After the sledging, Bairstow made 93 runs off 79 balls.

95.title: IndiGo crew took mass leave on Air India recruitment day causing flight delays: Reports
95.article_body: A significant number of cabin crew members of IndiGo had taken sick leave on Saturday when Air India conducted its recruitment drive, reports said on Sunday. PTI reported that the staffers took leave from work and went for the recruitment drive. This came after DGCA took note of the massive delays in IndiGo flights reported on Saturday.

96.title: Banking frauds of over ₹100 crore decline by over 50% in FY22: Data
96.article_body: The number of banking sector frauds worth over ₹100 crore declined to 118 in FY22 from 265 in FY21, official data showed. As per data, banks reported cases worth ₹41,000 crore in FY22 compared to ₹1.05 lakh-crore last year. This comes as RBI carried out a study on the implementation of Early Warning System framework in select banks in 2021-22.

97.title: 70 illegal constructions demolished in Bihar's Patna using 20 bulldozers
97.article_body: The administration in Bihar's Patna on Sunday cleared 40 acres of land after demolishing 70 illegally constructed houses in Rajiv Nagar during a demolition drive carried out using 20 bulldozers. Over 12 people, who resisted the anti-encroachment drive, were arrested amid clashes with police. Patna SP, along with some other policemen, sustained injuries in clashes, DM Chandrashekhar Singh said.

98.title: 59,000 Tesla cars have faulty emergency call system: German authority
98.article_body: Germany's road traffic agency said it is recalling Tesla models Y and 3 over a software glitch that affects 59,129 Tesla vehicles globally. As per the agency, the glitch causes breakdown of the eCall, which is designed to automatically contact emergency responders in the event of serious accidents. This comes as Tesla reported an 18% decline in deliveries in Q2.

99.title: Egypt shuts down several beaches after woman dies in shark attack
99.article_body: Egypt's Red Sea Governorate has issued an order demanding closure of several Red Sea beaches following a 68-year-old Austrian woman's death in a shark attack off the coast of Sahl Hasheesh on Friday. The victim swam to the shore after being attacked on her arm and leg, witnesses said. She reportedly succumbed to her injuries in the ambulance.

100.title: Personal attack on judges lead to dangerous scenario: SC judge who heard Nupur's plea
100.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice JB Pardiwala, who along with Justice Surya Kant heard Nupur Sharma's plea, criticised people for "personal attacks" on judges for their judgement. "Personal attacks on judges for their judgements lead to a dangerous scenario where judges have to think about what the media thinks instead of what the law really thinks," he stated.

101.title: Ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey summoned by ED in NSE co-location case
101.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on July 5 in connection with a money laundering case related to the National Stock Exchange (NSE) co-location scam, an official said on Sunday. The summons was sent on Saturday to Pandey, who retired from the police force on June 30, the ED official added.

102.title: Amravati killing was portrayed as theft, will be probed: Fadnavis
102.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said on Sunday that the theft angle in the killing of a chemist in Amravati will be probed. "Accused...have been nabbed...NIA is investigating [the case to find]...if there's some international connection," he added. The victim, Umesh Kolhe, was murdered on June 21 over his online posts in support of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

103.title: Vijay Deverakonda did a lot of posing routine for Liger's poster: Trainer
103.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's trainer Kuldep Sethi said the actor was in good shape for Liger, but for the photoshoot, which they shot a year ago, he had to train a little extra. "We started training and I...changed a bit of his workout style... It was...tiring for him but with this routine, he also got to showcase his muscle," he added.

104.title: Lashkar terrorist caught in J&K was BJP IT cell member, had quit 2 months ago
104.article_body: One of the two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists who were caught by villagers in J&K's Reasi on Sunday was a BJP IT cell member. Talib Hussain had worked as Jammu BJP Minority Morcha's IT and social media in-charge. BJP Minority Morcha president Sheikh Bashir said Hussain was working with BJP for a "long time" and had resigned two months ago.

105.title: Messi is the best: Xavi on comparison between Ronaldo and Messi
105.article_body: Comparing Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, Barcelona manager and former teammate of Messi, Xavi Hernandez said that Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward is the best in history, adding Messi does more things compared to the Manchester United forward. "Messi is the player that makes the most difference in the world. It's more than obvious," he added.

106.title: 2 men cheat Pune bank of ₹65 lakh by securing loan on forged docs
106.article_body: Two people allegedly cheated a private bank of ₹65 lakh by procuring loans using forged documents, reports said. In his complaint, the bank manager said that the accused used forged ITR documents and manipulated bank statements to apply for the loan. According to police sub-inspector S Girnar, one of the accused is associated with three more bank loan fraud cases.

107.title: 9-year-old boy dies as part of balcony collapses in Delhi's Rohini
107.article_body: A nine-year-old boy died after a portion of the balcony of an old house collapsed in the Begum Vihar area of Delhi's Rohini, police said. According to Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal, the boy was playing in front of the house when the incident took place. He was taken to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries, the DCP added.

108.title: Siblings impersonate beggars to commit theft, arrested in Mumbai
108.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested three people who pretended to be beggars and stole from multiple households, reports have stated. The accused, identified as Satyababa (40), Nisha (22) and Pooja (25), are siblings who hail from Maharashtra's Ahmednagar and had travelled to Mumbai along with a child with an intent to commit theft. They have been placed under judicial custody.

109.title: Rahul Gandhi stops car, helps man injured in road accident in Kerala; video surfaces
109.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recently helped a man injured in road accident in Kerala's Wayanad, a video of which has surfaced online. Rahul stopped his car on seeing the injured man and helped in taking him to a hospital in his convoy's ambulance. The video shows him helping with the stretcher while the man was being taken to the ambulance.

110.title: BJP govt in K'taka trying to communalise school curriculum: Sinha
110.article_body: The opposition candidate for the Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, on Sunday said that the BJP government in Karnataka was attempting to communalise the school curriculum in the state. He accused the Central government of launching repeated assaults on democracy and secularism. He added that the Centre has "unleashed poisonous communal propaganda to divide India's multi-religious society".

111.title: Johnny Depp gets tattoo of broken arrow post defamation case win
111.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp got a tattoo of a broken arrow on his underwrist a month after winning the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. The process reportedly took six hours. As per reports, a broken arrow signifies "a new start and new hope" after "burying the battle ax". Pictures and videos of Depp getting the tattoo are going viral.

112.title: BJP MP asks Raj CM to get mental treatment after nikamma remark for Minister
112.article_body: BJP MP Ashok Bajpai took a jibe at Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot for calling Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat "nikamma", saying that the CM should get mental treatment. He added that the CM's old age is visible in his conduct, adding that Shekhawat has worked hard to provide tap water in a short period of time.

113.title: Russia claims full control of Ukraine's Luhansk region as its last city falls
113.article_body: Russia on Sunday said it has taken control of eastern Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of the region's last Ukrainian holdout. The city of Lysychansk, which was a key Ukrainian city, and some nearby settlements fell under the control of Russian forces on Sunday, Russia claimed. Ukraine is, however, yet to comment on Russian claims.

114.title: 22-yr-old law student killed, his body thrown in UP drain; police probe role of gay app
114.article_body: Yash Rastogi, a 22-year-old law student, was killed and his body was thrown in a drain in gunny bag in UP's Meerut, police said. Three accused, reportedly identified as Shavej, Imran and Salman, have been arrested. Police are investigating the role of a gay app they were associated with amid reports that Yash blackmailed the accused with their objectionable video.

115.title: 200 families left homeless in Assam's Barpeta as river wipes out houses
115.article_body: Over 200 families in the Kachumara area of Assam's Barpeta district have been forced to move to other safer places after the Brahmaputra river wiped out their houses and several bighas of land. "Many roads of this area are also damaged due to river erosion," a local resident said. So far, at least 174 have died in Assam amid floods.

116.title: B'wood is playing safe by remaking films & not creating original content: Neil
116.article_body: Actor Neil Nitin Mukesh said that Bollywood tries to ‘play it safe’ by remaking films and not creating original content. "There are various sub-genres, like psychological thrillers, political thrillers, horror thrillers and so on. Why aren’t we exploring those?" he added. "We are still remaking films instead of coming up with original ideas and content," Neil said.

117.title: Akhilesh like Mughal emperors who oppressed kin for power: BJP MP
117.article_body: BJP MP Dinesh Lal Yadav on Sunday likened SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to the Mughal emperors, who he said oppressed their kin for the sake of power. "Reawakened Muslim and Yadav voters after 2014 have shattered the hope of the SP, which used to claim a monopoly over them," he said. SP is turning into a "samaptwadi party," he added.

118.title: AAP expanding in Guj, people tired of 27 yrs of BJP: Kejriwal
118.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that AAP is expanding on a huge scale in Gujarat, adding that the people of the state are tired of 27 years of the BJP. "BJP thinks Congress can't replace them, so they've developed ego. People are looking with hope towards AAP this time," he said.

119.title: BJP govt's policy is Gandhi in abroad & Godse in India: Yechury
119.article_body: CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury has criticised Centre for dismissing a US panel's recent report on religious freedom in India. "Policy of BJP government is Gandhi in abroad and Godse in...[India]...On one hand, [they] want to tell everyone that we have...democracy...and on the other, they're crushing...democratic rights inside [India]," he said. Panel had termed India a "country of particular concern".

120.title: Was confused about my tactics: Top seed Swiatek on 3rd round Wimbledon loss
120.article_body: Commenting on her third round loss against unseeded Alize Cornet at Wimbledon, world number one Iga Swiatek, who was on a 37-match winning streak, said she was confused about her tactics. "What can I say? I know I didn't play good tennis," she added. The top seed hit 33 unforced errors to Cornet's seven in the 6-4, 6-2 defeat.

121.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, disrupts traffic in several parts of Delhi
121.article_body: Heavy rainfall lashed parts of Delhi, leading to traffic disruption and waterlogging in many parts on Sunday, as part of an ongoing wet spell with the onset of monsoon. Areas like Mandi House, Tilak Marg and Pragati Maidan were reportedly flooded after the rainfall. Delhi had received heavy rainfall on Thursday, which brought the temperature below 30 degrees Celsius.

122.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary share first pic of daughter
122.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary shared the first picture of their baby girl on social media on Sunday. The couple can be seen kissing their daughter's cheeks as she looks into the camera. Debina wrote, "Introducing Lianna. Our heart united into one." Lianna is Debina and Gurmeet's first child together and was born on April 3.

123.title: Tiger Shroff shares throwback training video, says 'The struggle was real'
123.article_body: Tiger Shroff, taking to Instagram, shared a throwback video from his acrobatics training session. "Man the struggle and grind [were] real! Found some old training footage of little me with not so little dreams and my quest to become...action hero," he wrote. Actor Bhakhtyar Irani reacted to the video, writing, "When he was a cub...looked dangerous to kill even then."

124.title: We don't make family entertainers due to influence by the West: Varun
124.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan stated in an interview that Bollywood has stopped making big-scale masala family entertainers because it is too influenced by the West. "No one knows what type of films will work, from the biggest producers to trade people," he added. The actor further said that after COVID-19, one has to do "what your conviction says".

125.title: Ronaldo wants to leave Man Utd; doesn't feel ambition: Italian journalist
125.article_body: Italian transfer journalist Fabrizio Romano has claimed that Manchester United footballer Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English football club. "Ronaldo told Manchester United [that] he wants to leave this summer as he wants to see more ambition," Romano tweeted. He added that the 37-year-old footballer likes the club and its manager but doesn't feel the ambition.

126.title: I can hurt him on grass court: Nadal's next opponent Botic on their match
126.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal's next opponent at Wimbledon Botic van de Zandschulp has said he can defeat the two-time Wimbledon champion on the grass court in their fourth-round match. "The biggest challenge in tennis is to play Nadal at French Open...but [I've] more confidence here to really make a shot...I can hurt him on the grass court," stated Zandschulp.

127.title: Media loves to write that I'm bad for tennis but clearly not: Kyrgios
127.article_body: Talking about his third round win against fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas at Wimbledon, unseeded Australian Nick Kyrgios said, "Hell of an atmosphere and an amazing match. I honestly felt like the favourite coming [into this match]." He added, "Everywhere I go I seem to be having full stadiums...media loves to write that I'm bad for the sport but clearly not."

128.title: 4 killed, 3 injured as cylinder explodes during Punjab wedding function
128.article_body: Four persons, including three women and one girl, were killed and three sustained injuries after a cylinder exploded during a wedding function in Punjab's Fazilka district. The explosion was caused due to a leak in the regulator of a gas cylinder, according to police. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at a hospital, police added.

129.title: 10-year-old rape victim denied abortion in US' Ohio after SC ends abortion rights
129.article_body: A 10-year-old rape victim was denied an abortion in Ohio after the Supreme Court of the US overturned the Roe vs Wade decision last month. A child abuse doctor in Ohio contacted an obstetrician-gynecologist in Indiana, after receiving the girl who was six weeks and three days pregnant. She is now travelling to Indiana for an abortion, the Hill reported.

130.title: 'Pushpa' composer DSP, Honey Singh team up for Salman's Bhaijaan: Reports
130.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad aka DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise', and rapper Honey Singh have reportedly teamed up for a peppy number in Salman Khan's 'Bhaijaan'. "The makers have already recorded the song, and some who have heard it insist that it would be an earworm for the audiences," reports stated.

131.title: Can't believe England haven't learnt from their mistakes: Vaughan
131.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has criticised the English team for repeating mistakes that "happened at Lord's" Test in 2021. "You've got Stuart Broad and James Anderson...bowling to Jasprit Bumrah...They decide to go short with the field spread out...Can't believe they haven't learnt," Vaughan said. Notably, Broad went for 35 runs in an over against Bumrah at Edgbaston on Saturday.

132.title: Old is gold, a match-winner: Sehwag to Harbhajan on his 42nd birthday
132.article_body: Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish Harbhajan Singh on his 42nd birthday on Sunday and wrote, "Old is gold, wishing a match-winner and a guy who tries to keep the atmosphere jovial everywhere he goes." Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Happy Birthday Bhajji pa! You may be done with bowling, but you can never be done with entertaining! Keep shining brother."

133.title: Virat Kohli sledges Jonny Bairstow, makes fun of him; video goes viral
133.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli was seen indulging in a verbal argument with England's Jonny Bairstow during the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. In a video that has gone viral, Kohli was heard saying, "Little bit faster than Southee...eh?" While, in another video, he was seen making fun of Bairstow after he missed a delivery.

134.title: IndiGo flights hit by delays across India over staff shortage, DGCA seeks clarification
134.article_body: IndiGo flight operations have been hit with massive delays across India due to the non-availability of crew members, reports said on Sunday. Aviation regulator DGCA has taken cognisance of the issue and sought a clarification/explanation from the airline, ANI reported citing DGCA officials. As many as 900 IndiGo flights have been affected due to staff shortage, ET Now reported.

135.title: India coach job for me was to prove media wrong: Shastri
135.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that his coaching job with the Indian team for him was to prove the "media wrong". "The last thing I was worried about was media...The fact was that we were bullies at home and we didn't play great [overseas]. So my job...was to prove media wrong," Shastri said.

136.title: Incoming deliveries were bowled as part of strategy against Root: Zaheer
136.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Zaheer Khan praised Indian pacers for planning England batter Joe Root's wicket on Day 2 of their ongoing rescheduled Test. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami had a discussion...After that, incoming deliveries were bowled as part of the strategy," stated Zaheer. Mohammed Siraj dismissed Root for 31 with an incoming delivery that had some extra bounce.

137.title: Terrorism is raging because of Congress party: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
137.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that terrorism is raging because of the Congress party. "In Udaipur, there was recently a killing in broad daylight. We will crush terrorism. We will run bulldozers over the miscreants," Chouhan added. Furthermore, Chouhan said that Congress is a party of "polarisation" and the country lost its respect under their rule.

138.title: PM Modi, Shah’s decision to make me CM opened eyes of many: Eknath Shinde
138.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the decision of PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make him the Chief Minister despite having more members than his side "has opened the eyes of many". "Everyone knows that Devendra Fadnavis had 115 members with him. I had only 50," he added.

139.title: What I saw was bizarre, something I never imagined: Shastri on Bumrah's world record
139.article_body: Talking about Jasprit Bumrah breaking the world record for scoring most runs in an over in Tests, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "What I saw was bizarre." He added, "It’s something I’ve never imagined. The world record, from Bumrah, batting at number 10, as captain of India, for the first time." Bumrah scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over.

140.title: Twitter CEO takes coffee orders from staff during visit to UK office, pics surface
140.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal visited the company's office in the United Kingdom last week for a series of events. Employees took to Twitter to share photos of Agrawal taking coffee orders while another top Twitter executive, CFO Ned Segal served cookies along with it to the staff. The Managing Director of Twitter UK could also be seen with Agrawal.

141.title: Paris airport workers warn of another walkout from July 8 to 10
141.article_body: Paris airport workers, who have staged a series of strikes demanding higher salaries, have warned of another walkout from July 8-10, which can cause disruption for travellers. Earlier, airport operator ADP offered a 4% pay hike to the staff if they ended the ongoing strike. However, the workers rejected it saying it was not good enough.

142.title: Will test bullet that killed Al Jazeera reporter in West Bank: Israel
142.article_body: Israel said on Sunday that it'll test the bullet that killed a Palestinian-American journalist in May to determine whether one of its soldiers shot her. This comes after Palestine handed over the bullet to US experts after being reassured that Israel won't participate in ballistics test. The victim, Shireen Abu Akleh, was killed while covering a raid in West Bank.

143.title: Adele stops London concert midway to help fans, video viral
143.article_body: British singer Adele, who recently performed at London's BST Hyde Park Festival, stopped her performance four times to help fans. A viral video shows the singer asking the band to stop, walking to the front of the stage and directing security to the fans who needed help. This comes after 10 fans died during Travis Scott's Astroworld Festival in November.

144.title: Broad will always remember two names: Aakash on 35-run over in 5th Test
144.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said England's Stuart Broad will always remember two Indian players, Yuvraj Singh and Jasprit Bumrah. "Broad has created records which he won't be very proud of," added Chopra. Bumrah smashed Broad for the most expensive over in Test cricket history in the ongoing fifth Test, while Yuvraj had smashed him for six consecutive sixes in 2007.

145.title: Rebel MLAs were unable to look us in the eye: Aaditya Thackeray
145.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that rebel MLAs, who returned to Mumbai from Goa, were unable to look Shiv Sena in the eye. "How long are you going to move from one hotel to the other? These MLAs will have to go to their Assembly constituencies one day. How will they face the people then?" he asked.

146.title: New York bans guns in many public places after Supreme Court order
146.article_body: The US' New York state has banned carrying guns in several public places, including Times Square. Under the new law, gun-licence seekers will be required to prove their shooting skills and submit their social media accounts for review by the government. This comes days after the US Supreme Court ruled against New York's restrictive gun-licence laws.

147.title: Next 30-40 years to be era of BJP: Union Home Minister Amit Shah
147.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah said that the next 30-40 years will be the era of his party and India will become a “vishwa guru” (world leader). Furthermore, Shah, during the BJP's national executive meeting, said “dynastic politics, casteism and politics of appeasement” were the “greatest sins” and the reasons behind the country’s sufferings over the years.

148.title: Delhi Police bust fake call centre cheating US citizens, 12 held
148.article_body: Delhi Police busted a fake call centre involved in cheating US citizens on the pretext of redeeming gift cards and arrested 12 people. "On pointing out of informer a raid was conducted and it was found that a setup of computers and accessories were installed in the premises," said a police release. They presented themselves as Amazon representatives, it added.

149.title: Israel shoots down 3 Hezbollah drones heading towards gas field
149.article_body: The Israeli military said on Saturday that it had shot down three drones launched by the militant group Hezbollah. The Iran-backed Shi'ite group said in a statement that it had launched the unarmed drones towards the "disputed" Karish gas field for reconnaissance missions. "The message was delivered," Hezbollah added. One drone was intercepted by an Israeli fighter jet, AFP reported.

150.title: New sleeping pod hotel opens at Mumbai's CSMT station, pics released
150.article_body: Union Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday shared photos of the newly-opened sleeping pod hotel at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) in Mumbai. This is the second such facility of the Indian Railways in Mumbai. The new hotel is expected to have a capacity of 50 people along with amenities like key card access, air conditioning, and CCTV surveillance.

151.title: Robbers steal computers from Odisha school, scrawl 'Dhoom 4' on blackboard
151.article_body: Miscreants robbed computers and other electronic items from a high school in Odisha's Nabarangpur district and scrawled phrases like "Dhoom 4", "we will return" and "coming soon" on a blackboard. 'Dhoom 4' is an upcoming Bollywood film, featuring police and thieves. The thieves also allegedly wrote "catch us if you can" in Odia on the blackboard.

152.title: The track was brought to me as a joke: Ishq Bector on Aye Hip Hopper
152.article_body: Rapper-music composer Ishq Bector, speaking about his song 'Aye Hip Hopper', said, "The track came together when Hanif Shaikh brought it to me as a joke about a star hip-hopper and a romantic angle with his maid." "But then it...kind of snowballed," he said, adding, "I presented...demo to Sunidhi Chauhan and she nearly fell off...chair laughing...and agreed to sing [it]."

153.title: Accepting Deputy CM post must be a 'real shocker' for Fadnavis: Shiv Sena
153.article_body: In an editorial of its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena has said that accepting the Deputy CM post must have been a "real shocker" for BJP's Devendra Fadnavis. "...The climax at the Raj Bhavan was the most shocking part...Fadnavis accepted the [Deputy CM] post as the party leadership's order. But now being said...that Fadnavis showed a big heart," the editorial said.

154.title: Tribal woman set ablaze over land dispute in MP, 2 arrested
154.article_body: A tribal woman suffered severe burn injuries after three people set her ablaze over a land dispute in MP's Guna district, police said on Sunday. A video, purportedly shot by the accused, surfaced online, wherein the charred woman was seen crying in pain, with smoke all around her. The police arrested two of the three accused.

155.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
155.article_body: The Health Ministry on Sunday stated that there are 1,11,711 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 29,505. This is followed by Maharashtra (23,447), Tamil Nadu (13,319), West Bengal (9,290), Karnataka (6,440), Telangana (4,784), Gujarat (3,478), Delhi (3,410) and Uttar Pradesh (3,029).

156.title: Great taste my friend: Priyanka to kid who said he 'loves her' in TikTok video
156.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has reacted to a TikTok video where a child could be seen calling her pretty and saying he loves her. She shared the video on her Instagram Stories, writing, "Great taste my friend." The child was reacting to Priyanka's old picture from a 2017 article about her being declared the world's second most beautiful woman after a poll.

157.title: M-cap of 3 of top 10 most valued firms decline by ₹73,630 crore in past week
157.article_body: The market valuation of three of the 10 most valued domestic firms declined by ₹73,630.56 crore in past week. While Reliance Industries took the biggest hit and saw its valuation dipping by ₹62,100.95 crore to reach ₹16,29,684.50 crore. It was followed by ICICI Bank and HUL whose valuation dropped by ₹6,654.2 crore and ₹4,875.41 crore, respectively.

158.title: Is Bihar Police so incompetent?: Tejashwi after BJP tightens office security
158.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised BJP for increasing security in its party offices in Bihar amid protests against Agnipath scheme and said that they don't have faith in their own "double engine government". "The Bihar government should tell us whether the police is so incompetent so as to warrant deployment of central forces at BJP offices?" asked Yadav.

159.title: 19 dead after bus falls into ravine in Pakistan amid heavy rains
159.article_body: At least 19 people were killed and several others were left injured after a bus veered off a mountainous road amid heavy rains and fell into a ravine in Pakistan's Balochistan province on Sunday. The bus, which was reportedly carrying 30 passengers, was headed from Islamabad towards Quetta. The injured persons have been admitted to hospital, an official said.

160.title: Gadkari shares pics of new 4-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway, calls it 'magnificent'
160.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari shared pictures of the new four-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway on Twitter. "Magnificent due to its scenic view...this project is an important coastal highway link between west and south India," Gadkari stated. Gadkari added the four-laning of the highway is nearing completion, with 92.42% work already completed. He added the traffic is open on highway.

161.title: 27 missing as ship breaks in half amid typhoon in South China Sea, video surfaces
161.article_body: As many as 27 people are missing and feared dead as a massive ship broke into half and sank amid typhoon Chaba in the South China Sea. A video of the rescue has been released by the Hong Kong Government Flying Service and it shows some crew members being airlifted. The footage shows the offshore vessel partially submerged.

162.title: Kartik is the same person he was before Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success: Kriti
162.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Saturday shared a video with Kriti Sanon. In the video, the two were promoting his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. When asked if Kartik is the same guy he was before the success of the film, Kriti said Kartik continues to be the same person she knew before. "We don’t let him fly too high," Kriti jokingly added.

163.title: Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani's 'JugJugg Jeeyo' earns ₹100 cr worldwide
163.article_body: Director Raj Mehta's 'JugJugg Jeeyo', which features Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor, has earned over ₹100 crore worldwide. The actors took to their respective social media handles to thank fans. As per trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the film has crossed ₹61.44 crore at the Indian box office and is likely to cross ₹65 crore on Sunday.

164.title: 2 boys drown while swimming in artificial farm reservoir in Pune
164.article_body: Two boys, aged 13 and 14, drowned while swimming in an artificial farm reservoir in Pune's Dhayari area on Sunday. A third boy, who didn't get into the reservoir as he didn't know swimming, raised an alarm and called locals for help, a fire officer said. The bodies of the two deceased were recovered, the fire officer added.

165.title: PMC to buy additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for plantation drive
165.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will purchase additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for its planned tree plantation drive to increase the green cover in the city, according to officials. PMC Garden Department chief Ashok Ghorpade said that the drive was affected due to the delay in monsoons. "We have saplings at various nurseries, but we'll...purchase additional saplings," he added.

166.title: He is outstanding, a class act: Vaughan after Jadeja's 104-run innings
166.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has praised India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing rescheduled Test. "He's a class act. I was looking at his numbers over the last 20-odd Test matches. He's averaging 48, only second to Rohit Sharma," stated Vaughan. Jadeja's hundred helped India post 416 in the first innings.

167.title: 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons spotted near PM's meet venue in Secunderabad
167.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad's Parade Grounds on Sunday, 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons were spotted outside the venue. A video of the balloons has also surfaced online. This comes as political banners and posters, including a few inspired by the show 'Money Heist', among others, surfaced across various locations in Hyderabad recently.

168.title: Delhi govt gives 10-day grace period to comply with single-use plastic ban
168.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to be lenient towards those violating the ban on single-use plastic (SUP) items for the initial 10 days. It has launched a campaign to create awareness against the use of such commodities and promote their alternatives. The AAP-led government will also provide incentives to SUP manufacturing units willing to switch over to green alternatives.

169.title: 25-year-old Black man shot 60 times by police in US: Lawyer who watched bodycam footage
169.article_body: A 25-year-old Black man named Jayland Walker was shot over 60 times by police in Ohio after a pursuit over a traffic violation, the lawyer who watched body camera footage of the incident said. The footage will be released to the public on Sunday. The officers involved have been placed on administrative leave during an investigation, the department's statement said.

170.title: Even Kasab didn’t have so much security: Aaditya on protection for rebel Sena MLAs
170.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray reacted to security arrangements for rebel Shiv Sena MLAs and said that even terrorist Ajmal Kasab did not have such security. "We have not seen such security before in Mumbai. Why are you scared? Is someone going to run away?" Thackeray said. The rebel Shiv Sena MLAs reached Vidhan Bhavan in special buses today.

171.title: Italy's Venice becomes world's 1st city to announce entry fee for tourists
171.article_body: Italy's Venice has become the world's first city to announce an entry fee for tourists as it tries to tackle the problem of crowding and "overtourism". The city will charge a €3-€10 (₹247-₹823) entry fee from tourists starting January 16, 2023. Visitors will also have to make an online booking before travelling to Venice next year.

172.title: Rihanna makes first appearance in London after welcoming son
172.article_body: Singer Rihanna made her first public appearance after welcoming her baby boy with rapper A$AP Rocky at the Wireless Festival in London. A$AP Rocky was among the performers at the festival. Rihanna was seen in an all-black ensemble that included a puffer jacket with feathers all around the hoodie and black pants. The couple welcomed their son on May 13.

173.title: BJP made clear democracy is for sale: KC Venugopal on Maha political development
173.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress leader KC Venugopal said that BJP has made it clear that the democracy is for sale. "Anybody can come, take money and they get to join the BJP. This is the fate of democracy in India but the people of India will fight it," Venugopal added.

174.title: I hang my head in 'shame': Kapil Sibal on state of judiciary
174.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Sunday expressed concern over the current state of the judiciary, saying that some members of the institution have let us down, adding that he hangs his head in shame. Responding to the arrest of Mohammed Zubair, Sibal said it is "unthinkable" for a person to get arrested for a tweet from four years ago.

175.title: Viral video shows Swiggy delivery boy riding a horse to deliver order amid Mumbai rains
175.article_body: A video of a Swiggy delivery agent riding a horse to deliver an order amid heavy rainfall in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. Several people took to social media to praise the delivery agent for his dedication, with one user saying, "Now this is what I call 'Shahi delivery'." "Something rare to find," said another user.
