348.article_body: After Rishabh Pant hit 111-ball 146 in rescheduled fifth India-England Test in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said the India wicketkeeper-batter is definitely the best Test batter at the moment. Pant, who scored the hundred in 89 balls, broke MS Dhoni's record for the fastest Test century by an Indian wicketkeeper-batter. Dhoni had smashed a 93-ball hundred against Pakistan in 2006.

349.title: Crowd attacks, tears clothes of Udaipur killing accused outside court; video surfaces
349.article_body: A video has shown a crowd attacking the men accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's killing when they were presented before an NIA court in Jaipur on Saturday. The crowd is seen tearing the clothes of the accused men before police personnel put them in a van outside the court. All four accused were sent to a 10-day NIA remand.

350.title: Israel, Poland criticise Ukrainian envoy for defending WW2 nationalist
350.article_body: Ukraine's ambassador to Germany has been criticised by Israeli and Polish governments for his statement saying Ukrainian nationalist leader Stepan Bandera was not a "mass murderer of Poles and Jews". "The statement...belittles the Holocaust," the Israeli embassy stated. Bandera headed the radical wing of a Ukrainian nationalist group which killed tens of thousands of Poles during World War 2.

351.title: Blasts in Mykolaiv a day after 21 killed near Odesa in Ukraine
351.article_body: Explosions rocked the Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv on Saturday, said the city's mayor. "Stay in shelters!" the mayor warned city residents. This comes a day after at least 21 people were reportedly killed in an alleged Russian missile strike near Odesa. On Friday, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy termed the recent bombardment of Ukrainian cities as "conscious, deliberately targeted Russian terror".

352.title: Karthik criticises ECB over 'Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline for highlights
352.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik criticised England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) for 'Joe Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline of their YouTube video for highlights of Day 1 of the rescheduled fifth Test. Karthik wrote, "After such an engrossing, enthralling day's play, I'm sure the headline can be much better and apt than this." Pant slammed 146 runs off 111 deliveries.

353.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad, ex-Gujarat DGP sent to judicial custody
353.article_body: Activist Teesta Setalvad and former Gujarat DGP RB Sreekumar were on Sunday sent to judicial custody by a court in Ahmedabad. Earlier on June 26, the duo was sent to the Ahmedabad crime branch's custody for questioning till July 2. Their judicial custody will continue until bail is granted. So far, no bail application has been moved.

354.title: My character in 'Shamshera' is both funny, dangerous: Sanjay Dutt
354.article_body: Sanjay Dutt, while talking about his character Shuddh Singh in 'Shamshera', said that it's both funny and dangerous. "Audience should love him!" Sanjay said. "It's a character...you have never seen on screen...I loved the fact that Karan Malhotra created a villain like this and...thought of me to play this role," Sanjay had said earlier. 'Shamshera' also stars Ranbir Kapoor.

355.title: Salah signs new long-term Liverpool contract to extend Anfield stay
355.article_body: Mohamed Salah has signed a new long-term contract to extend his stay at Liverpool, the club announced on Friday. The forward was named FWA Footballer of the Year and PFA Players' Player of the Year for 2021-22 after helping Jürgen Klopp's side to a domestic cup double. Salah has scored 156 goals in 254 club appearances since arriving in 2017.

356.title: BJP's national executive meeting commences in Hyd; PM Modi present
356.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) two-day national executive meeting commenced in Hyderabad on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP chief JP Nadda and other party leaders are present in the meeting. Earlier today, PM Modi took to Twitter and informed that a wide range of issues aimed at further strengthening the party will be discussed in the meeting.

357.title: Premarital sex, premarital pregnancy are matters of personal choice: Dia Mirza
357.article_body: Dia Mirza has said even though many are critical of premarital sex and premarital pregnancy, "there are enough people who recognise...it's a personal choice". "I feel when it comes to...personal choice, it can only be celebrated...by...those who ensure they make personal choices," she stated. "I don't think we're as progressive as we imagine...ourselves to be," Dia told Times of India.

358.title: CCTV video shows alleged killers of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
358.article_body: CCTV footage has shown deceased chemist Umesh Kolhe being tailed by his alleged killers in Maharashtra's Amravati. Kolhe was stabbed to death on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma. The footage was recorded between 10 pm and 10.30 pm when Kolhe was reportedly waylaid by the accused while he was returning home from his pharmacy.

359.title: Keep the flag high, proud of you: Harbhajan on Jadeja's ton in 5th Test
359.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Ravindra Jadeja following the India all-rounder's century in the first innings of rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Jadeja, that's one of the best inn [innings]...what a 100...keep the flag high...Jadeja very proud of you," he wrote. Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Valuable hundred baapu. Batting at his peak of ability." Jadeja scored a 194-ball 104.

360.title: Audience didn't want to let go of my image after Mohabbatein: Preeti
360.article_body: Preeti Jhangiani, who made her Bollywood debut with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Mohabbatein in 2000, said the audience had a certain image of her after the film which they didn't wanted to let go. "But...times have completely changed now, so I don't think that's an issue," she said, adding that she might return to acting if she gets an interesting role.

361.title: Father-son make video of married woman, blackmail her for money in Mysuru
361.article_body: Karnataka Police have booked father and son for allegedly blackmailing a married woman with her private video in Mysuru. The accused, who lived near the woman's house, allegedly recorded her video on phone while bathing and had been using it to blackmail her to extract money for the past two years. As per authorities, they also harassed her sexually.

362.title: Former Kerala MLA PC George arrested in sexual harassment case
362.article_body: Senior Kerala politician and former MLA PC George was on Saturday arrested on charges of sexually harassing a woman, who is also an accused in the solar panel case. George reportedly claimed that he was arrested as part of a conspiracy by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The woman has alleged that George had invited her to the guest house in Thycaud.

363.title: 35,870 Russian soldiers killed, 1,582 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
363.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed around 35,870 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 1,582 Russian tanks and over 400 aircraft, including 186 helicopters. The ministry said that 3,737 armoured personnel carriers, 800 artillery systems and 246 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed.

364.title: Messaged Świątek a couple of times as her gameplay has been crazy: Nadal
364.article_body: Talking about world number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek who's on a 37-match unbeaten run, Rafael Nadal said, "I've messaged [Iga] a couple of times because what she's playing is crazy." "The way she's able to keep her focus and winning spirit for so long is unbelievable...I'm quite happy that a girl like her is so successful," added Nadal.

365.title: My films get made, what can I do: Akshay on Madhavan's 40 day remark
365.article_body: On being asked about R Madhavan's comment on actors giving only 40-45 days to shoot a film, actor Akshay Kumar said, "My films get made, what can I do? It's not in my control that my films wrap up so fast." The actor further said, "If a director...tells me my work is done, go home, should I fight with him?"

366.title: Husband is very supportive of my political career, it has shocked me: Urmila
366.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said in an interview that her husband, Mohsin Akhtar, has been "so extremely supportive" of her political career that it has shocked her. "He has given me more strength to speak my mind out, the way I have been speaking," Urmila said, adding, "After being...a blessed daughter, I am a blessed wife and a daughter-in-law."

367.title: Root knows DNA of Test cricket; that's what makes him great: Chopra
367.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that English batter Joe Root knows the "DNA of Test cricket" and that makes him "great". "Root likes to cut the ball or use the backfoot punch or pull and knows how to build his innings," Chopra said. "There is a very small window of opportunity to get Root out," he added.

368.title: PM Modi has not actually understand MGNREGA: Rahul Gandhi
368.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was "shocked" when PM Narendra Modi spoke against the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) in Lok Sabha. "PM called [MGNREGA] a living monument of the failures of the UPA," Gandhi said. "It made me realise that the PM actually had not understood the depth of MGNREGA," he added.

369.title: Woman kills 3-yr-old daughter before dying by suicide in Bengaluru
369.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly killed her 3-year-old daughter and later died by suicide at her apartment in Bengaluru's RR Nagar on Thursday. According to police, the deceased was depressed over her health issues. Her husband who works as a software engineer also lived with them in the apartment. An investigation is underway to ascertain whether the couple had marital problems.

370.title: Taron Egerton confirms meeting Marvel chief for Wolverine role
370.article_body: Actor Taron Egerton in an interview with The New York Times confirmed that he has been in talks with Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige and other executives about taking on the role of Wolverine, previously played by Hugh Jackman. "Hopefully if it does come around, they'll give me a shot," the 'Rocketman' actor added.

371.title: Nikki tests COVID positive for 2nd time, says couldn't breathe at one point
371.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has tested positive for COVID-19. The actress stated that she initially neglected the symptoms assuming it to be a change in weather. "However, when I was coming back to Mumbai in...flight, I just couldn't breathe at one point," Nikki added. Notably, this is the second time that Nikki has tested positive for the virus.

372.title: Got to win overseas Tests to become world number 1: Pat Cummins
372.article_body: After winning the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle, Australian skipper Pat Cummins said that one needs to win overseas Tests to be the world's "number one" team. "...Mitchell Starc working on the reverse swing, Nathan Lyon coming up with a few new balls. There is so much to learn and be successful on these (Lankan) wickets," Cummins said.

373.title: Elon Musk tweets tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who died from cancer at 23
373.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted a tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who passed away due to stage four cancer on July 1. "Cancer is an absurd piece of literal garbage and death," the image shared by Musk read. Technoblade, whose real name was revealed as Alex after his death, had more than 12 million subscribers on YouTube.

374.title: 'Zubair's bail plea order leaked by Delhi DCP', says his lawyer; officer clarifies
374.article_body: After reports claimed that the bail plea of fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was rejected by a Delhi court, Zubair's lawyer said the order was "leaked" to the media by Delhi DCP KPS Malhotra. Advocate Soutik Banerjee said the judge has reserved the matter for judgment and called Malhotra's actions "scandalous". Malhotra clarified that he "misheard" the order that was "inadvertently" broadcast.

375.title: Terrible feeling to be in opposing box against Novak: Ex-coach Vajda
375.article_body: Novak Djokovic's former coach Marian Vajda, who coached the tennis player for 15 years, said it was "very strange to be in the opposing box" against Djokovic during a French Open 2022 match. Tennis player Alex Molcan, who's being coached by Vajda, played against Djokovic in the second round. "It was a terrible feeling...Novak...also felt very bad," stated Vajda.

376.title: 91-yr-old billionaire Rupert Murdoch's 4th wife Jerry files for divorce after 6 yrs
376.article_body: Model Jerry Hall has filed for divorce from media tycoon Rupert Murdoch after six years of marriage. Hall has cited "irreconcilable differences" between her and Murdoch, and sought unspecified spousal support from the 91-year-old billionaire. This will be the fourth divorce for Murdoch. The 66-year-old model was previously the long-term partner of The Rolling Stones' lead vocalist Mick Jagger.

377.title: Do something honourable about your honour: Anupam on SC's statement on Nupur
377.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher reacted to the Supreme Court's statement on former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, tweeting, "Your Honour! Do something honourable about your HONOUR!" The Supreme Court had stated, "She has a threat or she has become a security threat?...This lady is single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country. We saw the debate."

378.title: HIV speeds up body’s ageing process soon after infection: Study
378.article_body: HIV has an early and substantial impact on the process of ageing, a study has found. Highlighting the need for early diagnosis of the infection, the study stated that HIV can start impacting ageing within just two to three years of contracting the virus. Moreover, HIV may rapidly cut about five years off an individual's life span, it stated.

379.title: Govt grants financial help to families of 35 deceased journalists
379.article_body: The central government has approved a proposal of the Journalist Welfare Scheme Committee to provide financial relief of ₹5 lakh to the families of 35 deceased journalists, including those who died due to COVID-19. The committee has also recommended assistance to two journalists suffering from permanent disability. The committee has approved a total assistance of ₹1.81 crore during a meeting.

380.title: Gambia bans all timber exports to combat rosewood smuggling
380.article_body: The Gambia on Friday banned timber exports and revoked all timber export licences to combat the illegal smuggling of endangered rosewood. The government has also instructed port authorities to oversee and prevent any loading of logs onto any vessels. The West African nation has exported an estimated 1.6 million rosewood trees since 2012, according to the Environmental Investigation Agency.

381.title: Shoes, jackets, ornaments barred for Himachal police re-exam after paper leak
381.article_body: Following the paper leak of the written test held in March to recruit Himachal Pradesh Police constables, examinees taking the re-examination on Sunday have been prohibited from wearing jackets and metal ornaments in the examination hall. The examinees also have been asked to wear slippers and flip-flops, instead of socks and shoes. They have been barred from carrying electronic devices.

382.title: Priyanka's brand criticised for being overpriced, people point out tablecloth worth ₹30,000
382.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who recently launched her homeware brand SONA Home, has been called out for keeping the prices of the items 'exorbitantly high'. "I wanna be rich to a point where I can casually buy a SONA Home tablecloth worth ₹30,000," a tweet read. "Whitewashed millionaire Indian selling overpriced bulls**t to goras as 'exotic' Indian designs," another person commented.

383.title: Ranveer Singh made Alauddin Khilji in Padmaavat look 'terrifying': Ranbir
383.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent video shared by Yash Raj Films, praised actors who have essayed negative roles in films. "In Padmaavat, Ranveer...made Alauddin Khilji so terrifying, that even after...film ends, the character stays with you," Ranbir said. He also called Shah Rukh Khan's role in 'Darr' the "most iconic". "My dream is to play a negative role," Ranbir added.

384.title: I would've been fined 15,000 pounds: Kyrgios on Bublik's underarm serves
384.article_body: Discussing tennis player Alexander Bublik's six underarm serves in his third round match of Wimbledon 2022, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios tweeted, "If it was me, I [would've been]...fined a minimum of 15,000 pounds." Kyrgios added he would have also been "accused of tanking". Kyrgios was recently seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon match.

385.title: Single-use plastic ban good, but alternatives are costly: Traders
385.article_body: As single-use plastic  (SUP) items have been banned in India, Delhi traders selling these items said alternatives to SUPs are few and costly. Delhi-based Rajeev Sahni, who runs a shop selling disposables, said, "The ban...is good. But we need easily available [and] pocket-friendly alternatives." "Customers are running away now since prices of (alternatives to SUPs) have risen," a wholesaler said.

386.title: Delhi Police constable kills self with service pistol; body found in car
386.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly shot himself dead with his service revolver in Prashant Vihar, Delhi. The deceased, Amandeep Singh, was posted at the Prashant Vihar Police Station and was on casual leaves. The deceased's body was found lying inside a car parked near a petrol pump, police said. Notably, the body has been sent for post-mortem, police added.

387.title: Jasprit Bumrah breaks world record for scoring most runs in an over in a Test match
387.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah on Saturday broke the world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test. The 28-year-old scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over in first innings of rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston. Bumrah slammed four fours and two sixes, and took a single. Broad conceded 35 runs in the over, including six extras.

388.title: Dad told me my films are good but they won't make me a national star: Ranbir
388.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed that his father, Rishi Kapoor, would tell him that the kind of films he does are good but they won't make him a "national star". "Now I understand...what he was trying to say," he added. Ranbir further said he always looks at his favourite heroes "from a low angle", adding, "I never see them as...equal to me."

389.title: PM Modi govt spends 6 times more on railways in Gujarat than UPA: Shah
389.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Narendra Modi-led Central government spends six times more money annually on railways in Gujarat than the previous UPA government. "UPA used to spend ₹590 crore every year on the railways in Gujarat. PM Modi increased this spending to ₹3,960 crore between 2014 and 2022," Shah added.

390.title: Modi govt is successfully killing democracy everyday: Telangana CM
390.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has accused the BJP-led Centre of "killing" democracy. "What the Modi administration is doing is successfully killing democracy everyday, throttling the federal system...toppling governments which do not toe their line," CM Rao said. "PM Modi is the 15th PM...and in terms of the last 14 PMs, never has India's image been affected," he added.

391.title: Bulgaria destroys Soviet-era naval mine off its Black Sea coast
391.article_body: Bulgaria's Defence Ministry said its military has carried out a controlled explosion of a Soviet-era naval mine that had drifted close to the country's Black Sea coast. The mine was first spotted by a motor ship, it added. Black Sea countries began to report the appearance of such mines floating in the sea after Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

392.title: India score 35 runs as Stuart Broad bowls most expensive over in Test cricket history
392.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in Test history after India aggregated 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. India captain Jasprit Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining runs came off extras.  The previous most expensive over in Test history went for 28 runs.

393.title: BJP denies link to Udaipur killing accused as pics of him with local leaders emerge
393.article_body: After several pictures showing Udaipur killing accused Riyaz Akhtari with members of the Rajasthan BJP surfaced online, the party denied having any links with him. "Anyone can have a photo with any leader. It doesn't mean that he's a member," said Rajasthan's BJP Minority Morcha chief Mohammad Sadiq Khan. An India Today report said Akhtari had attended BJP events.

394.title: Heavy jewellery in 'Chamma Chamma' could have got me hospitalised: Urmila
394.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar, while talking about her song 'Chamma Chamma', recalled how director Rajkumar Santoshi told her to reduce the jewellery she was wearing as they were too heavy for dancing. The actress said that she refused and was later hit by the ornaments during the shoot. "By...end of those four days, I could've been hospitalised from all...scratches," she added.

395.title: Haven't seen him on set: Mandar on reports of Raj Anadkat quitting 'Taarak...'
395.article_body: Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays Bhide on 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reacted to reports claiming actor Raj Anadkat has quit the show. "As artists, we don't know if he has quit...but he'd some health issues due to which he hasn't been shooting for...past few days. I haven't seen him on...set," he said. Raj plays Tapu on the show.

396.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia opens 1.2 km km-long Benito Juarez Marg underpass
396.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday inaugurated the 1.2 km-long Y-shaped Benito Juarez Marg underpass. The underpass starts at the Delhi Metro's Durgabai Deshmukh South Campus station and connects the South Campus to AIIMS and Moti Bagh. "Adding to the economic value of saving time, this underpass will save ₹18 crore for Delhiites every year," Sisodia tweeted.

397.title: Govt warns edtech firms against unfair trade practices, misleading ads
397.article_body: The Central government has warned edtech companies against unfair trade practices and said that if self-regulation doesn't curb such practices, stringent guidelines will be formulated. Consumer Affairs Secretary Rohit Kumar Singh flagged concerns over misleading ads and increasing fake reviews. Notably, the education category was the largest violator of advertising code in 2021-22, as per ASCI.

398.title: Viruses make people more attractive to mosquitoes: Study
398.article_body: Mosquitoes choose their target on basis of people's body temperature, odour and CO2 from their breath. Some viruses alter body odour in a way that makes people more attractive to mosquitoes, a study stated. They can also transfer the virus from an infected person to another person through bites. Researchers also found that mosquitoes are more attracted to acetophenone's odour.

399.title: Delhi court rejects Zubair's bail plea, sends him to 14-day judicial custody
399.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair's bail plea and sent him to a 14-day judicial custody in a case related to an "objectionable" tweet he had posted in 2018. Delhi Police produced Zubair before the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate and sought a 14-day custody after seizing his mobile phone and recovering a hard disk during investigation.

400.title: Anand Mahindra shares pics from Pant's knock against England, says 'Test cricket tandav'
400.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a collage of pictures from Rishabh Pant's 146-run knock against England in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Test cricket tandav. Rishabh Pant is a sports artiste. Impossible not to marvel at him," Mahindra wrote alongside the collage. Rishabh recorded the fastest Test hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper off 89 deliveries.

401.title: Mithali shares letter PM Modi wrote on her retirement, says 'I'll treasure this forever'
401.article_body: Former India Women captain Mithali Raj took to Twitter to share a letter PM Modi wrote to her while congratulating her on her retirement. "It’s a matter of singular honour & pride when one receives such warm encouragement from our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi ji," she wrote. She added, "I will treasure this forever."
